games

Class Checkers2

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.Game
      • games.Checkers2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer

    public class Checkers2
extends Game
implements java.util.Observer
    This class implements the game Checkers (also known as Draughts).
    Version:
    $Revision: 0.1 $
    Author:
    Helion

        Displays the remaining amount of pieces available to every player

      • displayStatusOnConsole

        public void displayStatusOnConsole()
        Used for debugging: Displays the current checkerboard's status on the console. Will display . for unreacheable slots, 0 for empty and available slots, 1 for player 1 regular pieces, 2 for player 2 regular pieces, 3 for player 1 king pieces, 4 for player 2 king pieces.

      • doControlsCheck

                            int player)

      • lightControls

        private void lightControls()
        Turns on the extra 'settings' lights. [0][0] is used to quit the game [0][1] is used to reset the game [1][8] is used to show if player 2 needs to play [8][8] is used to show if player 1 needs to play

      • nextCheckOutOfGameBounds

        private boolean nextCheckOutOfGameBounds(int x,

        boolean playerCanMove(int player)

      • playerwon

        private void playerwon(int winner)
        If a player has won, blink a specific pad and clear all the slots that don't contain the winning player's pieces. This is just to show the remaining player's pieces' positions since it looks nice
        Parameters:
        winner - Winning player (1 or 2)

      • quitGame

        public static void quitGame()
        Quits the game. Clears the pads and resets the Launchpad to it's normal "out of game" status. It should be ready to be used for other games or animations after.

      • quitGameQuery

        private static void quitGameQuery()
